entry.title: Migrating SAP Profile and Microservices to SAP BTP Kyma
entry.content:
Over the past months, our SAP Community Portal team took on one of the most ambitious infrastructure projects in recent years: migrating the SAP Profile and the supporting microservices of the SAP Community Platform from SAP BTP Neo and SAP Converged Cloud (Kubernikus) to SAP BTP Kyma Runtime.

This was more than a technical migration: We wanted to strengthen our platform for the long term, simplify operations, and empower the team with modern cloud-native tools and practices.

Motivation

Over time, our platform had grown across multiple environments ‚Äî SAP BTP Neo and SAP Converged Cloud (Kubernikus) ‚Äî each with its own operational footprint and limitations. To continue evolving the SAP Community and SAP Profile, we needed a foundation that was both modern and sustainable.

Our goals were clear:

  • Increase development speed and efficiency through improved tooling, automation, and infrastructure

  • Reduce operational costs and complexity by adopting SaaS-managed databases and retiring legacy Neo Global Accounts

  • Address security and maintenance risks tied to the aging Kubernikus environment

Solution

To achieve this, we migrated a suite of critical services, including the Avatar Service, Subscription Service, Session Service, and Khoros Firehose Integration, to SAP BTP Kyma Runtime.
We also switched to SAP BTP PostgreSQL, introduced NATS for messaging, and integrated everything into Hyperspace build pipelines for streamlined CI/CD.

The transition required close collaboration between development, operations, and architecture teams. Careful planning, extensive testing, and phased rollouts helped ensure that users experienced no disruptions ‚Äî even as we moved the foundation of the platform beneath their feet.

SAP runs SAP

This migration is part of SAP‚Äôs broader transformation journey - applying our own cloud technologies internally and learning from the experience. By moving our services to SAP BTP Kyma, we‚Äôre contributing to SAP‚Äôs ‚ÄúRun SAP on SAP‚Äù strategy and setting the stage for continued innovation in the years ahead.

To achieve this, we migrated a suite of critical services, including the Avatar Service, Subscription Service, Session Service, and Khoros Firehose Integration to SAP BTP Kyma Runtime. We also switched to BTP PostgreSQL, introduced NATS for messaging, and integrated everything into Hyperspace build pipelines for streamlined CI/CD.

Acknowledgments
Special thanks to @weckerle, @aliona_boltromeyuk, @hyerimm, @irene-glaz, @erikdietz284 as well as @MirkoFriedrich and @yaniv for leading this effort and to all consultants who contributed their expertise throughout the migration.

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Pune 2025 ‚Äî A Celebration of Ideas, Energy, and Collaboration
entry.content:
Once again, the SAP community in Pune showed its strength, passion, and drive. On 11th October 2025, SAP Inside Track Pune returned for its second edition ‚Äî and it was nothing short of spectacular.

A Community Reunion

From the moment doors opened, the buzz in the air made it clear: this wasn‚Äôt just an event ‚Äî it was a community coming together. Over 200+ enthusiastic participants, 20+ speakers, and a dedicated team of volunteers gathered at SAP Labs India, ITPP, Pune to learn, share, and grow. The energy, camaraderie, and excitement were palpable.

ü§ù Voices That Inspire

We kicked off with an inspiring keynote by Saicharan Krishnamoorthy, tracing the journey of SAP Inside Track and spotlighting how far Pune has come on its SAP path. The stories shared, insights revealed, and vision laid out set a vibrant tone for the day.

The main stage was beautifully hosted by Punith Oswal (@Punith_Oswal), SAP Champion and member of the SIT core team. His energy and expertise set the perfect tone for the day‚Äôs sessions.

A Day of Deep Dive Learning

This year‚Äôs focus ‚Äî Business AI in SAP ‚Äî resonated through every session and conversation. From AI Strategy to Embedded AI, SAP BTP, modernization, and partner innovations, speakers took us on a rich journey of possibilities. Every talk, every case study, and every Q&A added layers of real-world relevance, innovation, and practical wisdom.

Sessions and Tracks

The event featured a variety of sessions divided across four different tracks, allowing attendees to dive deep into the topics that piqued their interest. Each session was packed with invaluable insights and the latest trends in the SAP ecosystem:

Gratitude to Our Pillars

Events like this don‚Äôt happen on their own. A heartfelt thank you to:

Our Esteemed Partners: Amazon Web Services, Rojo Integrations B.V , Mindset Consulting LLC,  Primus TechSystems, SAP Press - Your support and belief made this event a great success!

Our speakers, for generously sharing your stories, expertise, and bold ideas.

Our core team and volunteers, who poured time, energy, and love into every detail ‚Äî from logistics to hello smiles.

A huge shout-out to Saicharan Krishnamoorthy (@saicharank ) and Devprasad Kambli (@Devkambli) for leading the team from the front, your efforts went above and beyond to make sure everything came together flawlessly!

Unforgettable Moments and Key Takeaways

One of the standout aspects of SAP Inside Track Pune 2025 was witnessing the sheer enthusiasm and energy of Pune‚Äôs vibrant tech community. Professionals, learners, and SAP enthusiasts from across India came together to share knowledge, exchange ideas, and explore the latest innovations in the SAP ecosystem ‚Äî creating an atmosphere that was truly inspiring. The presence of participants who travelled from cities like Bangalore, Hyderabad, and Mumbai added incredible diversity and a sense of unity to the event.

Beyond the sessions and keynotes, the event was filled with opportunities to connect, collaborate, and build lasting relationships. Participants engaged with peers, SAP experts, and thought leaders ‚Äî sparking discussions that could lead to new collaborations, innovative solutions, and enhanced skills across SAP technologies and integration.

SIT Pune 2025 was more than just an event; it was a celebration of community, curiosity, and collaboration. Everyone ‚Äî from attendees to speakers, volunteers, and partners ‚Äî walked away with valuable insights and experiences, contributing to something truly special in Pune‚Äôs SAP ecosystem.

Looking Ahead

Reflecting on the success of SIT Pune 2025, the excitement for the future is palpable. Pune has firmly established itself on the SAP map, and this is just the beginning. The energy, passion, and ideas shared during this event have laid a strong foundation for even bigger opportunities, collaborations, and innovations in the years ahead.

Let‚Äôs keep the momentum going! If you couldn‚Äôt attend, make sure to follow our SAP Inside Track Pune pages on LinkedIn and join the SAP Pune Community group for updates, future events, and exclusive content.

The future of SAP in Pune is brighter than ever ‚Äî and we‚Äôre only getting started! 

A heartfelt thank you to everyone who made SIT Pune 2025 such a tremendous success. Here‚Äôs to many more milestones, learning, and moments of inspiration for the SAP community in Pune and beyond.

 

Until Next Time....

Cheers!

SAP Community Pune - Core Team

entry.title: SAP CodeJam HANA ML in Porto 2025-09 Recap
entry.content:
At the end of September, we held an SAP CodeJam event in Vila Nova de Gaia, Portugal. The event focused on exploring the foundations of AI applications with the SAP HANA Cloud: Vector Engine and Knowledge Graph Engine.

Thanks to the local host and organizers: @MatheusBrasil , @MRobalinho and the rest of the team...

...and participants!

It was great to have my teammate and fellow developer advocate @qmacro joining us... not only during the lunch break üêü

SAP CodeJam in Porto was the day before the very first SAP Inside Track there, so it was great to share a drink during a Stammtisch after the CodeJam...

 The following day, I had a chance to present the long story of LLM auto completion to AI agents‚Äîwe went in just three years! And invited everyone to join SAP TechEd to watch our Developer Keynote.

November is going to be an intensive month with SAP TechEd on Tour in Berlin, Sydney, and Bengaluru, followed by SAP CodeJams in Melbourne, Singapore, and the Middle East.

I always take the opportunity to experience at least a little bit of the city I am in, so you can see my photos: https://www.instagram.com/p/DPyfRcMDKko/?img_index=1

Would you like to host such an SAP CodeJam?

entry.title: SAP Community Voice: ABAP Innovations, Rules on GenAI for content creation and Devtoberfest recap!
entry.content:
In just the first two weeks of October, we‚Äôve already seen amazing blog posts from community members and SAP employees. This month, we‚Äôve already seen step-by-step guides to make your ABAP journey smoother, new features in the Clean Core Cloudification Repository Viewer, SAP Joule for Developers hitting a new milestone and exciting new set of Badges!

Have you joined any Devtoberfest sessions yet? Participated in Fun Activities? Collected points along the way? We also remind you that this free, online event is a must this month!

And there‚Äôs plenty more initiatives and events happening across the SAP community all over the world. Let‚Äôs dive in and see what‚Äôs new!

Featured blog posts

New features on Clean Core Cloudification Repository Viewer  

Going through your SAP Clean Core journey? Then this overview about the new Clean Core Cloudification Repository Viewer (CRV), by SAP¬¥s Rundong_Liu, is a must read! With his hands-on experience supporting RISE with SAP Customers, he showed all the new features in this update version, that includes clearer interface with filters for product, release, state, and Clean Core levels. A highlight is the introduction of the ‚ÄúPartner Namespace‚Äù, which certified partners are now able to publish released APIs as well. Make sure to check the whole blog post, to have a look at the guide with images and explanations on how to navigate and improve the experience with CRV.

Read the blog post here

ABAP RAP ‚Äì How to Excel upload through custom action popup

Mass data changes that are uploaded via Excel, sometimes can be challenging because the execution often requires a custom action popup. Involving U15 extensions, third-party solutions or Object Page manipulations. But, on the latest blog post by the community member Ramjee Korada, he walks through the 10 steps on implementing the new ABAP/CAP annotations, that allows developers to prioritize implementing core business logic over developing reusable technical artifacts. This feature is currently functional on the BTP ABAP Environment.

Read the blog post here

News about SAP Joule for Developers and ABAP AI capabilities

Last week big news about accelerating ABAP innovation and transformation were released, and SAP¬¥s Sonja Lienard gave our members a full overview on the updates. Joule for Developers and ABAP AI capabilities are now available in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition 2025. Additionally, the new Custom Code Migration capabilities accelerate the transformation of classic ERP code to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, including Documentation Chat (answers on SAP S/4HANA simplifications), ABAP Program Explain (purpose and logic of legacy code) and Explain for SAP S/4HANA Test Cockpit Issues (diagnosis and resolution using simplification items and cookbooks). Also, a big highlight is that SAP Joule for Developers will remain free of charge!

Read the blog post here

Pallets in SAP CPI Integration Flows

If you are trying to find a step-by-step on how to use Pallet in SAP CPI, the content produced by the community member Ankit Singh prepared, could be what you have been looking for. Using the example of a toolbox, this feature allows to drag and drop frequently used patterns across different projects, making it more efficient so you don¬¥t have to rebuild every time. The key features are Process, Transformation, Mapping, Call, Routers, Persistence, Security, and Miscellaneous. Be sure to read the full description of each Pallet and make your own life easier when using the system!

Read the blog post here

Community News

New Progression Badges for Discussion!

Been an active member and speaking your mind also comes with rewards. Now our platform will give badges specifically for members who kick conversations off by starting discussions. The first for starting your first discussion, the second for three discussions, the third for ten, and the fourth for twenty. The biggest milestone is the fifth badge, awarded for starting fifty discussions! These five badges set will be awarded retroactively, which means that if you have already initiated discussions in the community, you will be notified. This is our way to recognize the members who take the time to bring positive contributions, educating other members, and connecting! Make sure to read here more details about it.

Preserving the integrity of the community content

We all know how Generative AI can accelerate learning, content creation, and sometimes be very useful. But our SAP Community team believes that it is only worth it when it is used thoughtfully. It is non-negotiable to us, the preservation of trust and accuracy. When someone copies and paste AI-generated answers without verification, the risk of spreading misinformation increases and we lose the essence behind the discussions on SAP Community.  It is highly recommended that if you need to use GenAI tools to draft, plan, and refine your content, the final text still reflects your personal expertise. Now ‚ÄúGenAI Assisted Content‚Äù label can be also found and added. SAP¬¥s Anne Petteroe explained all the details on her latest blog post here, and the examples of unacceptable usage. The complete generative AI guidelines for the SAP Community can be found in our Welcome Corner group. 

Have you shared about you on SAP Community Hobbies Series?

Last month, we shared the launch of the SAP Community Hobbies Series, which is a way of sharing the things you love to do and connecting with other members that maybe share the same interests. For this edition, we would like to shoutout our SAP Champion Sebastian Marchesini, that recently posted about his journey with running. This lifelong hobby, for Sebastian it became more than just a sport, but most importantly turned into an enjoyable moment, stress escapism and confidence booster for new challenges. Read here all about his lessons learned with running and join the series, because we would love to know more about what makes you happier!

Events

Devtoberfest 2-week Recap and Petoberfest!

Our SAP community has been showing up and bringing their best in the last two weeks of the Devtoberfest 2025, and first we would like to thank you for interacting and bringing such good energy to the sessions. Starting with ABAP and finishing with CAP, in case you missed or would like to give a second look on any speaker's presentations, here is the list for all last week agenda. Last but not least, the Fun Activities have been such a nice way to challenge everyone and earn points! And the biggest highlight goes for the Petoberfest, with the cutest images of our members' lovely pets (plus the AI generated dogs wearing SAP outfits!). You are definitely not going to regret taking a look at this adorable pictures here.  Let¬¥s not forget that for every activity is possible to earn points for the Grand Prize, the validation tutorials can be found in our Tutorial Navigator. 

Day in the life of a Developer at SAP TechEd

What an amazing way to kick off the SAP TechEd! And in case you are feeling that good anxiety for your days in Berlin, there are many ways to prepare yourself ahead. SAP¬¥s Richard Kuba shared his ‚ÄúDay in the life of a Developer‚Äù with his three days agenda including the sessions he is planning to attend. Richard also made sure to include his thoughts on why he thinks participating in SAP TechEd can be super valuable for real-world projects. We are sure that you will feel very inspired as well, so don‚Äôt miss it: SAP TechEd Berlin and Virtual happens from November 4 ‚Äì 6.  

SAP will co-host the next InnerSourceSummit!

The InnerSource Summit 2025 is happening on November 13, bringing nearly 24 hours of global content on hybrid format, from Yokohama, Berlin, and New York. Hosted by SAP, Mitsubishi Electric and IBM, this year‚Äôs summit marks the 10th anniversary of the InnerSource Commons Foundation. SAP¬¥s Guilherme Dellagustin, shared on his latest blog post on Berlin Location Group, more details about SAP participation on the event, the full agenda and how to register. If you are available, we encourage you to check it out and bring with you another SAP community member from your area to connect, learn and grow!

entry.title: 9 Things You Need to Know About SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin
entry.content:
9 Things You Need to Know About SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin 

SAP TechEd in Berlin is just around the corner and it‚Äôs not your typical tech conference: it‚Äôs where SAP Community comes home. To help you make the most of your time on-site, here are 9 must-know ways to experience the community in action. 

1. Connect at the Community Clubhouse 

Think of this as your community hub. It‚Äôs the place to meet other members alongside the SAP Community team, swap ideas, share experiences, and just hang out with people who are as passionate about SAP as you are.  Come join your community in Hall 1.2  

2. Dive into the Developer Garage 

The Developer Garage is a hands-on playground where you can work alongside Developer Advocates on real projects. With 7 tracks and 32 tutorials, it‚Äôs the perfect space to get practical experience and try out the latest SAP technologies. 

3. Learn from the Experts 

From product owners in AI, ABAP, and CAP to SAP Champions and Mentors, the ‚ÄúMeet the Experts‚Äù tables are where you can ask questions, get insights, and gain practical tips straight from the people building SAP solutions. 

4. Explore the Community Theatre 

Catch 33 community talks, participate in trivia competitions, and check out the DemoJam at the end of Day 1 (15:00‚Äì16:15 Berlin time, session DJ1295), hosted by Mr. Bluebeard himself. Teams will have 6 minutes to tackle a real business challenge using SAP BTP, showcasing innovation, creativity, and fun. Stop by the Community Clubhouse to see who takes home the DemoJam trophy.  

5. Explore Learning and Certification Opportunities 

SAP TechEd in Berlin offers a dedicated space for certifications. Learn what certifications are available, understand their value, and even take free onsite certification exams for SAP Generative AI Developer and SAP Build Developer in Berlin, Bangalore, or Louisville. Find more details and register for the exam. 

6. Step into the SAP TechEd Experience Center 

Discover the future of enterprise technology, from Business AI to live robotic demos. Experience gamified learning, explore customer use cases, and take home a smart tag and learning badge to continue your journey long after the event.  Make your way to Hall 3.2 for all the experience center has to offer. 

7. Get to Know the SAP Community Platform 

Whether you‚Äôre new or seasoned, the SAP Community info space will help you navigate the platform, find groups, and even learn how to become an event organizer or start a local location group. 

8. Connect with Mentors and Champions 

Curious about the SAP Mentors or SAP Champions programs? Stop by booth 103 in the Clubhouse, learn about the programs, and discover how you can become more involved in the community. 

9. Don‚Äôt Miss the Developer Keynote 

The developer keynote is a highlight for anyone interested in the latest innovations and the roadmap of SAP technologies. 

SAP TechEd in Berlin isn‚Äôt just about sessions and workshops, it‚Äôs about being part of the SAP Community in real life. Whether you‚Äôre rolling up your sleeves in a hands-on tutorial, swapping stories at a casual meetup, or catching insights from an expert talk, every corner of the event is designed to help you connect, share, and grow alongside fellow community members. 

We can‚Äôt wait to see you there! Come ready to learn, share, and be part of the SAP Community energy ü§ù

entry.title: Student trying to break in into SAP? I've a few insights
entry.content:
So you're a student or recent grad trying to break into SAP, and honestly? I know every job posting seems to want "2-3 years of experience." 

Let me break it down for you. Most of you just need a game plan instead of falling down random YouTube "tech" rabbit holes.

I've helped a ton of people get started in SAP (and watched quite a few become consultants), so here's the "good" pattern I saw:

1. Stop trying to learn everything at once

SAP is huge. Like, overwhelming huge. It's got finance stuff (FICO), supply chain (MM), sales (SD), HR (SuccessFactors)... the list goes on. Here's the thing though, you don't need to master it all. Pick ONE area that makes sense for your background. Most of you are not starting from scratch. For example: Studied accounting? Start with finance modules. Have an HR degree? SuccessFactors might be your lane.

Bottom line: Go deep in one area first. You can always branch out later.

2. Create your own experience

Trust me: recruiters aren't expecting you to have years of SAP experience yet. They just want to see that you're actually doing something. You can get hands-on through:

  • Free SAP learning platforms (SAP Learning has student editions, BTP has a Free Trial - just dig out there)
  • Practice environments where you can click around and experiment
  • Creating sample projects ‚Äî even walking through a basic business process counts. 

Post about it on LinkedIn. Something like "Finally figured out how purchasing workflows work in SAP MM today ". It might sounds small, but very important for decision makers to notice you.

3. LinkedIn > your GPA (seriously)

I've watched people with okay grades but solid LinkedIn profiles get hired in like 3 months. Why? Because that's where recruiters are looking first.

Your headline should actually say what you're working toward: "Future SAP Consultant | Finance Grad | Currently Learning FICO & S/4HANA"

Simple change, but it tells people you're serious and helps the right opportunities find you.

4. Certifications help, but they're not everything

Yeah, getting certified can open doors. But what keeps those doors open? Actually understanding how to solve business problems with SAP. In interviews, the person who can explain why a company would use SAP beats the person who just memorized exam questions every time.

5. You're actually ahead of the curve

A lot of the experienced consultants are moving into senior roles, which means there's huge demand for fresh talent right now. If you start learning today and stay consistent, you're positioning yourself perfectly.

My take? Pick your module/solution. Practice regularly . Share what you're learning online. Don't wait until you "feel ready" ‚Äî you'll get ready by actually doing it.

Keep at it. Important: Collaborate here with the SAP Community - there's always someone going through the same challenges as you.

Daniel Kiel
https://www.linkedin.com/in/danielkiel/

entry.title: Brazil as One of the Leading Hubs for Artificial Intelligence (2024‚Äì2025)
entry.content:
Over the past two years, Brazil has established itself as one of the main Artificial Intelligence (AI) hubs globally, standing out for its combination of public investments, expanding business ecosystem, and regulatory progress. Traditionally a leader in innovation and technology in Latin America, Brazil is now attracting international attention by accelerating the adoption of AI across strategic sectors such as finance, energy, agribusiness, and public services.

In 2024, the Brazilian government launched the Brazilian Artificial Intelligence Plan (PBIA) 2024‚Äì2028, a program with an estimated investment of R$ 23 billion dedicated to AI research, development, and infrastructure. The plan aims to strengthen technological sovereignty, foster innovation through universities, and support companies in applying AI to practical use cases, particularly in areas of public interest.

The Main pillars of the PBIA 2024‚Äì2028 are:

  • Expansion of AI research and innovation centers;
  • Tax incentives for startups and public‚Äìprivate partnerships;
  • Training and qualification of AI professionals;
  • Implementation of AI in public services (health, security, education).

This initiative positions Brazil as a regional leader in AI policy, ahead of countries like Mexico, Chile, and Argentina.

Brazil‚Äôs private sector is undergoing a phase of rapid AI adoption. By 2025, a national survey identified 396 Brazilian AI companies focused on marketing applications, reflecting diversification across generative AI, automation, analytics, and digital services.

According to a Bain & Company (2025) study, 67% of Brazilian companies now consider AI a strategic priority, a major leap from 2024, when only about 12% had active projects. This demonstrates the transition from experimental use to mature, production-level adoption.

Brazil received international investments and technological infrastructure. That's why Brazil‚Äôs consolidation as an AI hub also stems from the confidence of major global players. In September 2024, Microsoft announced a US$ 2.7 billion investment in cloud and AI infrastructure in Brazil, one of the largest technology investments in Latin American history. In 2025, Eletrobras partnered with C3 AI to modernize Brazil‚Äôs power grid using AI and machine learning, highlighting the industrial applications of advanced technologies.

These moves strengthen Brazil‚Äôs position as a regional hub for data and high-performance computing, essential for scaling generative AI and automation initiatives.

Despite major progress, Brazil still faces structural challenges. A SAP Brazil (March 2025) survey revealed that:

  • 29% of companies lack clarity on how to integrate AI into their business systems;
  • 28% cite a shortage of skilled professionals as the main obstacle.

On the regulatory front, Brazil has emerged as a key player. In 2024, the National Data Protection Authority (ANPD) suspended Meta Platforms‚Äô privacy policy, which used Brazilians‚Äô personal data to train generative AI models. This decision marked an important milestone in ethical governance and digital sovereignty, aligning Brazil with European-style data protection principles.

The main sectors driving AI growth in Brazil include:

  • Finance and digital payments: automation and predictive analytics;
  • Energy: smart grids and real-time system optimization;
  • Agribusiness: crop forecasting and climate analytics;
  • Healthcare: assisted diagnostics and telemedicine;
  • Public administration: chatbots and natural language processing for citizen services.

These industries attract investments from both large corporations and local startups, making Brazil a fertile ground for experimentation and innovation.

About the Outlook for 2025 and Beyond the trends indicate continued expansion of generative AI and process automation in Brazilian companies. By the end of 2025, it is expected that:

  • Over 60% of corporate AI solutions in Brazil will involve generative models;
  • The country will consolidate international research and training partnerships;
  • The General Artificial Intelligence Law (under discussion in Congress) will advance the national governance framework.

With growing public and private investments, Brazil is on track to become a Latin American reference in AI innovation and ethics, combining economic growth with responsible technological governance.

The 2024‚Äì2025 period marks a strategic turning point for AI in Brazil, shifting from an emerging topic to a core pillar of industrial and business competitiveness. The alignment between government vision, international investments, and technological maturity positions Brazil as one of the leading AI hubs in the Southern Hemisphere, with the potential to export technology, talent, and regulatory best practices.

At MakeValue, we develop AI-powered applications for SAP Finance, focused on enhancing financial visibility and decision-making. Our Cash Flow Intelligence App leverages data from Supply Chain, Sales, Treasury, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, and real-time Bank Balances to deliver accurate forecasting and scenario simulation, ensuring that financial teams have a clear, data-driven view of their company‚Äôs liquidity at any time.

Is your company already exploring AI implementation projects? In which sectors or business processes are you seeing the greatest potential for transformation?

References

  • Reuters: Microsoft to invest $2.7 billion in Brazil
  • Reuters: Brazil proposes $4 billion AI investment plan
  • SAP News Brazil (2025): Brazil leads in AI adoption among enterprises
  • Bain & Company (2025): Artificial Intelligence Adoption Survey
  • Instituto IA ‚Äì LNCC (2024‚Äì2025): Mapping of AI Research Groups in Brazil
  • Poder360 (2024): Brazil to become Latin America‚Äôs AI hub with R$ 22 billion by 2028

entry.title: Building and Deploying Custom Joule Skills for a CAP-Based Fiori Application
entry.content:
Building and Deploying Custom Joule Skills for a CAP-Based Fiori Application and Integrating with SAP Build Work Zone

In this tutorial, we will guide you through the process of creating a custom Joule skill tailored to a CAP (Cloud Application Programming) based Fiori application. You‚Äôll learn how to deploy this skill and enable Joule functionality within SAP Build Work Zone, enabling intelligent, conversational interaction within your enterprise apps.

Step 1: Configure a Destination in Your SAP BTP Subaccount

Begin by setting up a destination in your SAP BTP subaccount where Joule Studio is subscribed. This destination should point to the endpoint of your CAP service.

Ensure you add the following property in the additional settings:

sap.processautomation.enabled = true

 

sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled = true

 

sap.build.usage = CAP

This configuration allows SAP Build to consume the service.

 

Step 2: Add Destination in the Control Tower

Next, go to the Control Tower section within the SAP Build Process Automation cockpit and add the destination you just created.

 

Step 3: Start a New Action Project

Navigate to the Actions tab and click Create to initiate a new action project.

 

Step 4: Choose SAP Cloud Application Programming Model

Since your action will interact with a CAP service, select SAP Cloud Application Programming Model as the project type.

 

Step 5: Select and Configure Service Endpoints

  • A list of available service endpoints from your CAP application will be displayed. Pick the desired endpoint and complete the necessary configuration.

 

  • Click on Next
  • Give You Project Name

 

 

  • Create Action for the ODATA Service
  • Select required endpoint and configure it.

  

 

  • Test the Endpoint with destination and see the output

 

 

  • Create similar action for the all department data and test it

 

 

 

Step 6: Build and Deploy Your Joule Skill

  • Click Create to set up the action project. Then, select the Joule Skill tile and create the skill

 

  • Open the above skill and again create joule skill and give name and description

 

  • Open he above skill and add action like below

 

  • Configure destination for this action

 

  • Configure the Output Variable for this action

 

  • Set the output variable on clicking on End
  • Create similar joule skill for department by following above steps

 

  • Once you finish, Save, Release

 

 

 

 

  • After Releasing Click on Deploy and choose the environment that you want

 

 

Step 7: Enable Shared Access

  • Go to home page and click on Control Tower
  • Choose Environment
  • Select Environment that we choose for our Joule Skill you will see your deployed skill there

 

 

  • Click on Setting and Enable shared option

Step 8: Connect Joule with SAP Build Work Zone

At the global account level, access the Formations area. Select Include Systems and add SAP Build Work Zone from the appropriate subaccount.

Activate these features:

  • Enable Joule Icon in Integrated System

 

Step 9: Confirm Integration and Activate Joule

Verify your setup under System Landscape ‚Üí Formation.

Then, log into your SAP Build Work Zone site.

Step 10: Validate Your Skills

Open your Work Zone site to see the Joule Icon appear at the top.

 

Test your deployed skill by typing queries related to your CAP application and observe how Joule responds.

 

 

 

Summary

Integrating custom Joule Skills into SAP Build Work Zone allows you to embed conversational AI directly within your business applications. This guide demonstrated how to connect a CAP-based Fiori app, configure necessary destinations, deploy custom skills, and enable Joule for seamless interaction.

By following these steps, you enable end users to engage naturally with enterprise data and processes‚Äîmaking your applications smarter, more interactive, and easier to use.

entry.title: Building the Future of Enterprise AI: MCP Servers and Agent-to-Agent Communication Revolution
entry.content:
Building the Future of Enterprise AI: MCP Servers and Agent-to-Agent Communication Revolution

Transforming how AI systems collaborate in modern enterprise environments

 

The enterprise AI landscape is experiencing a paradigm shift. While individual AI agents have proven their worth in specific domains, the real transformation happens when these intelligent systems can seamlessly collaborate, share knowledge, and coordinate complex workflows. Enter two revolutionary protocols that are reshaping how we think about AI integration: Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Agent-to-Agent Protocol (A2A).

The Integration Challenge: Breaking Down AI Silos

Picture this: You're managing an e-commerce platform with specialized AI agents for inventory management, fraud detection, customer recommendations, and order fulfillment. Each agent performs exceptionally within its domain, but when a customer wants to modify a large order that was flagged for unusual purchasing patterns while using a promotional code‚Äîsuddenly your streamlined system becomes a coordination nightmare.

This scenario illustrates the fundamental challenge facing modern enterprises: AI agents operating in isolation. Without standardized communication protocols, organizations struggle with:

  • Integration Complexity: Each new AI tool requires custom integration work, consuming valuable development resources
  • Data Inconsistency: Different systems use varying data formats, leading to translation errors and processing delays
  • Workflow Fragmentation: Multi-step processes require manual intervention to bridge gaps between AI systems
  • Scalability Limitations: Adding new capabilities means exponentially more integration points to maintain

The result? Expensive, brittle AI implementations that fail to deliver their full potential.

Model Context Protocol (MCP): The Universal AI Language

 

Model Context Protocol addresses the first half of this challenge by creating a standardized way for AI applications to communicate with external systems and data sources. Developed by Anthropic, MCP serves as a universal translator that eliminates the need for custom integrations.

How MCP Transforms System Integration

Traditional AI integration requires developers to:

  • Learn each system's unique API structure
  • Handle different authentication methods
  • Parse varying data formats
  • Maintain separate codebases for each integration

MCP changes this by providing a unified interface that abstracts away system-specific complexities. Think of it as having a universal remote control that works with every device in your smart home, regardless of brand or model.

Core MCP Components

MCP Host: Acts as the central coordination hub, managing all communication between AI clients and external systems.

MCP Client: Represents your AI application that needs to access external resources or capabilities.

MCP Server: Exposes specific functionalities, data sources, or services in a standardized format that any MCP client can understand.

What MCP Servers Provide

Tools: Executable functions that AI agents can discover and use dynamically. For example, a customer service AI could discover and invoke tools for order lookup, refund processing, or inventory checking without needing pre-programmed knowledge of each system.

Resources: Access to both static and dynamic data sources. This might include real-time inventory levels, customer databases, product catalogs, or analytical reports‚Äîall accessible through a consistent interface.

Prompts: Reusable, parameterized templates that maintain consistency across different AI interactions while allowing for customization based on specific contexts.

Real-World MCP Benefits: E-commerce Transformation

Consider an online retailer implementing MCP across their AI ecosystem:

Before MCP: Their recommendation engine needed separate integrations with the inventory system, customer database, pricing engine, and analytics platform. Each integration required months of development and ongoing maintenance.

After MCP: The recommendation engine simply queries the MCP ecosystem for "customer profile," "available products," and "pricing data." The MCP servers handle all the complexity of connecting to underlying systems, transforming data formats, and managing authentication.

Result: Development time reduced from months to weeks, maintenance overhead decreased by 60%, and new AI capabilities can be added without touching existing integrations.

MCP's Business Impact

Accelerated Development: Teams can focus on AI logic rather than integration plumbing, reducing time-to-market for new AI features by up to 70%.

Enhanced Reliability: Standardized interfaces reduce integration bugs and improve system stability.

Future-Proofing: When underlying systems change, only the MCP server needs updating‚Äîall connected AI clients continue working without modification.

Cost Efficiency: Reduced integration complexity means lower development and maintenance costs, with some organizations reporting 50% savings on AI infrastructure expenses.

Agent-to-Agent Protocol (A2A): Orchestrating AI Collaboration

 

While MCP solves the AI-to-system challenge, Agent-to-Agent Protocol tackles the equally important problem of AI-to-AI communication. A2A enables different AI agents to discover, communicate, and coordinate with each other to handle complex, multi-step workflows.

The Multi-Agent Coordination Challenge

Modern business processes rarely fit within a single AI agent's capabilities. Consider a customer support scenario where a client reports a billing error on their account. This seemingly simple request actually requires coordination between:

  • Customer Service AI: To understand the query and manage the interaction
  • Billing System AI: To identify and analyze the billing discrepancy
  • Fraud Detection AI: To ensure the request isn't part of a fraudulent pattern
  • Account Management AI: To determine appropriate remediation steps

Without A2A, each handoff between agents requires manual intervention or custom integration work.

A2A's Coordination Framework

Dynamic Discovery: Agents can automatically discover other agents' capabilities through standardized "Agent Cards" that describe what each agent can do, what inputs it needs, and what outputs it provides.

Role-Based Organization: A2A defines clear roles‚Äîcoordinators who manage workflows, specialists who handle specific tasks, and observers who monitor and provide insights.

Task Lifecycle Management: Every interaction follows a structured lifecycle from task creation through completion, with standardized status updates and error handling.

Flexible Communication: Agents can exchange various content types‚Äîtext, images, structured data, or complex multimedia‚Äîthrough a unified messaging framework.

Transformative Healthcare Use Case

Let's explore how A2A revolutionizes healthcare coordination‚Äîa domain where precise, timely collaboration literally saves lives:

Scenario: A patient arrives at the emergency department with chest pain.

Traditional Approach:

  • Triage nurse manually enters patient data into multiple systems
  • Various specialists are paged individually
  • Lab orders are placed through separate systems
  • Results are manually communicated between departments
  • Treatment decisions involve multiple phone calls and consultations

A2A-Enabled Approach: The Emergency Coordinator Agent automatically orchestrates the entire process:

  1. Immediate Assessment: Delegates initial evaluation to the Triage AI, which processes symptoms and assigns priority
  2. Parallel Specialist Coordination: Simultaneously engages Cardiology AI for cardiac risk assessment, Lab AI for stat blood work orders, and Radiology AI for imaging protocols
  3. Real-Time Collaboration: As results become available, each specialist AI provides recommendations that are automatically integrated into a comprehensive assessment
  4. Coordinated Decision Making: The Treatment Planning AI synthesizes all inputs to recommend optimal care pathways
  5. Resource Optimization: Bed Management AI ensures appropriate room assignment while Pharmacy AI prepares necessary medications

Outcome: What traditionally took hours of coordination happens in minutes, with improved accuracy and reduced human error.

A2A's Healthcare Benefits

Reduced Response Times: Emergency protocols that previously required 30-45 minutes now complete in under 10 minutes.

Improved Accuracy: Standardized communication eliminates transcription errors and ensures all relevant information is considered.

Enhanced Care Quality: Parallel processing allows for more comprehensive evaluation without delays.

Resource Optimization: Intelligent coordination prevents resource conflicts and optimizes staff utilization.

Audit Trail: Every decision and communication is logged, providing complete visibility into care processes.

The Synergy: MCP + A2A = Enterprise AI Excellence

The true power emerges when MCP and A2A work together, creating an ecosystem where AI agents can seamlessly access any enterprise system while coordinating sophisticated workflows with other agents.

Manufacturing Excellence Example

Consider a smart manufacturing facility where quality control, predictive maintenance, supply chain, and production planning agents work together:

MCP Integration: Each agent accesses manufacturing data through standardized interfaces‚Äîproduction metrics, equipment sensors, inventory levels, and quality reports‚Äîwithout needing to understand the underlying industrial systems.

A2A Coordination: When the predictive maintenance agent detects potential equipment failure, it automatically:

  • Alerts the production planning agent to adjust schedules
  • Informs the supply chain agent to expedite replacement parts
  • Notifies the quality control agent to increase inspection frequency
  • Coordinates with the facility management agent to schedule maintenance windows

Result: Unplanned downtime reduced by 80%, maintenance costs decreased by 40%, and product quality improved through proactive interventions.

Financial Services Transformation

In banking, compliance, risk management, customer service, and fraud detection agents collaborate to provide comprehensive financial services:

Real-Time Risk Assessment: When a customer applies for a loan, the application automatically triggers parallel processing across multiple AI agents‚Äîcredit analysis, fraud detection, regulatory compliance, and market risk assessment‚Äîwith results synthesized in minutes rather than days.

Automated Compliance: Regulatory changes automatically propagate through the agent network, with each agent updating its decision-making criteria and reporting mechanisms without human intervention.

Enhanced Customer Experience: Customer service agents can instantly access comprehensive customer profiles while coordinating with specialized agents for investment advice, loan modifications, or dispute resolution.

Strategic Implementation Benefits

Organizational Advantages

Scalability Without Complexity: Adding new AI capabilities becomes as simple as plugging in new agents‚Äîthe underlying infrastructure handles all communication and coordination automatically.

Reduced Technical Debt: Standardized protocols eliminate the accumulation of custom integrations that become expensive to maintain over time.

Faster Innovation: Teams can experiment with new AI agents without worrying about integration challenges, accelerating the pace of innovation.

Improved ROI: Organizations typically see 3x faster deployment of new AI capabilities and 60% reduction in integration costs.

Operational Excellence

Enhanced Reliability: Built-in error handling, circuit breakers, and failover mechanisms ensure system resilience even when individual components fail.

Better Visibility: Comprehensive monitoring and logging provide unprecedented insight into AI system performance and decision-making processes.

Simplified Management: Centralized configuration and monitoring reduce operational complexity while improving control over AI behaviors.

Compliance Readiness: Standardized audit trails and governance frameworks make it easier to meet regulatory requirements.

Addressing Implementation Challenges

Security and Trust Considerations

Authentication and Authorization: Both protocols include robust security frameworks to ensure only authorized agents can access specific resources or communicate with other agents.

Data Privacy: Built-in privacy controls protect sensitive information while enabling necessary collaboration between agents.

Audit and Compliance: Comprehensive logging and monitoring capabilities support regulatory requirements and internal governance policies.

Performance Optimization

Efficient Communication: Both protocols are designed for high-performance scenarios with minimal overhead and optimized message formats.

Load Balancing: Intelligent distribution of work across agent networks prevents bottlenecks and ensures optimal resource utilization.

Caching and Optimization: Smart caching mechanisms reduce redundant operations and improve overall system responsiveness.

Change Management

Gradual Adoption: Organizations can implement MCP and A2A incrementally, starting with high-value use cases and expanding over time.

Training and Education: Success requires investment in team education to help developers and administrators understand the new paradigms.

Cultural Shift: Moving from custom integrations to standardized protocols requires organizational commitment to new development approaches.

Future Outlook: The Evolution of AI Collaboration

Emerging Trends

Multi-Modal Communication: Next-generation implementations will support rich media communications, enabling agents to share images, video, audio, and complex data visualizations as part of their coordination efforts.

Federated Learning: Agents will be able to share and improve their models collaboratively while maintaining data privacy and security.

Self-Healing Networks: Advanced implementations will automatically detect and recover from failures, redistributing work and spawning replacement agents as needed.

Cross-Organization Collaboration: Future versions may enable secure collaboration between agents across organizational boundaries, creating industry-wide AI ecosystems.

Industry-Specific Evolution

Healthcare: Integration with medical devices, electronic health records, and regulatory systems will enable comprehensive patient care coordination.

Financial Services: Real-time market data integration and regulatory compliance automation will transform trading, lending, and risk management.

Manufacturing: Integration with IoT sensors, robotics, and supply chain systems will enable fully autonomous production optimization.

Retail: Seamless integration across online and offline channels will create truly omnichannel customer experiences.

Measuring Success: Key Performance Indicators

Technical Metrics

Integration Speed: Time to integrate new AI capabilities reduced from months to weeks

System Reliability: Uptime improvements of 99.9% or higher through robust error handling

Performance Optimization: Response time improvements of 40-60% through efficient communication protocols

Maintenance Reduction: 50-70% reduction in integration maintenance overhead

Business Metrics

Time to Market: Accelerated deployment of new AI features and capabilities

Cost Savings: Reduced development and maintenance costs through standardization

Innovation Velocity: Increased rate of AI experimentation and deployment

Competitive Advantage: Enhanced ability to respond quickly to market changes and opportunities

Getting Started: Practical Implementation Steps

Phase 1: Assessment and Planning

Current State Analysis: Evaluate existing AI implementations and identify integration pain points

Use Case Prioritization: Select high-value scenarios where MCP and A2A can deliver immediate benefits

Technical Readiness: Assess infrastructure and team capabilities for protocol implementation

Phase 2: Pilot Implementation

Limited Scope Deployment: Start with a single, well-defined use case to prove value and learn lessons

Performance Baseline: Establish metrics for comparing before and after implementation results

Team Training: Invest in education and skill development for development and operations teams

Phase 3: Scaled Deployment

Gradual Expansion: Systematically extend implementation to additional use cases and systems

Governance Framework: Establish policies and procedures for managing the expanded AI ecosystem

Continuous Optimization: Regular performance review and optimization of agent interactions and system performance

Conclusion: The Collaborative AI Future

The integration of Model Context Protocol and Agent-to-Agent Protocol represents a fundamental shift in how we architect and deploy enterprise AI systems. By standardizing communication between AI and enterprise systems (MCP) and enabling sophisticated coordination between AI agents (A2A), organizations can unlock the full potential of collaborative artificial intelligence.

The transformation is profound:

  • Development cycles shortened from months to weeks
  • Maintenance overhead reduced by 50-70%
  • System reliability improved to 99.9%+ uptime
  • Innovation velocity increased by 3x or more

The opportunity is immediate:

  • Protocols are mature and ready for enterprise deployment
  • Implementation can begin with high-value, low-risk pilot projects
  • Benefits compound as more agents and systems join the ecosystem

The competitive advantage is significant:

  • Organizations that adopt these protocols will be able to deploy AI capabilities faster and more reliably than competitors
  • The ability to coordinate complex, multi-agent workflows will become a key differentiator
  • Standardized approaches will enable innovation at unprecedented scale

Whether you're in healthcare, finance, manufacturing, or retail, MCP and A2A provide the foundation for building sophisticated, resilient, and scalable AI ecosystems that can transform how your organization operates and competes.

The future of enterprise AI isn't about individual agents working in isolation‚Äîit's about orchestrated networks of specialized agents working together seamlessly to deliver exceptional business outcomes. Start your journey toward collaborative AI excellence today.

Key Resources:

  • Strategic Planning: Begin with a comprehensive assessment of your current AI landscape and identify high-value integration opportunities
  • Technical Implementation: Consider partnering with experienced system integrators who understand both protocols
  • Change Management: Invest in team education and organizational change management to ensure successful adoption
  • Continuous Improvement: Plan for ongoing optimization and expansion of your collaborative AI ecosystem

  • Enable Joule Icon in Integrated System

 

Step 9: Confirm Integration and Activate Joule

Verify your setup under System Landscape ‚Üí Formation.

Then, log into your SAP Build Work Zone site.

Step 10: Validate Your Skills

Open your Work Zone site to see the Joule Icon appear at the top.

 

Test your deployed skill by typing queries related to your CAP application and observe how Joule responds.

 

 

 

Summary

Integrating custom Joule Skills into SAP Build Work Zone allows you to embed conversational AI directly within your business applications. This guide demonstrated how to connect a CAP-based Fiori app, configure necessary destinations, deploy custom skills, and enable Joule for seamless interaction.

By following these steps, you enable end users to engage naturally with enterprise data and processes‚Äîmaking your applications smarter, more interactive, and easier to use.

entry.title: Returning to ASUG After 10 Years: Join Me at ASUG Tech Connect 2025
entry.content:
Ten years. That's how long it's been since I last attended an ASUG event back in 2015. As I prepare to head to Louisville, Kentucky for ASUG Tech Connect 2025 (November 4‚Äì6), I find myself excited to reconnect with old friends and making new connections in the SAP Community after a decade-long gap.

This time, I'm returning in my role as Product Manager for SAP LeanIX solutions , ready to share the latest innovations in enterprise architecture management and automated discovery capabilities with you.

What I'll Be Presenting

I'm thrilled to be (co-)running three sessions at the event, each designed to give you hands-on experience with the latest developments in SAP LeanIX:

Session 1: SAP LeanIX Solutions: Powering Transformation and Connecting IT to Business

Learn about the latest product developments in SAP LeanIX and what they mean for your enterprise architecture practice.

Session 2: Hands-on Lab: Navigating Transformations with the Integrated Toolchain

This session is purely interactive and hands-on for participants. Explore how SAP LeanIX, SAP Signavio, and SAP Cloud ALM work together to enable organizations to drive smarter decision-making and accelerate digital transformation projects.

Session 3: SAP Signavio and SAP LeanIX Roadmap Overview and Deep Dive

Dive into the integrated product roadmap of SAP Signavio and SAP LeanIX, engineered to enable cross-functional collaboration across enterprise architecture, process management, and transformation initiatives.

 

Besides these sessions, you can find me at the SAP booth and connect with me via the ASUG Events app. Furthermore, you can now book your Expert 1:1 appointment with me. As part of these talks, I‚Äôd love to particularly discuss ‚Äúmy‚Äù two favorite roadmap items on https://roadmap.leanix.net/

  • ‚ÄúSAP landscape discovery: Discover context to self-built software deployed to SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime‚Äù: Let me share the latest updates on its developments.
  • ‚ÄúApplication Discovery: Discover classic on-stack SAP ERP extensions‚Äù: I love to discuss the problems SAP LeanIX can address in this context and which jobs-to-be-done might help your transformation journey.

Fresh from SAP TechEd Berlin: The AI Agent Hub

I closely work with my colleague Michelle and thus can share details related to her blog post on the AI agent hub. It will be covered in my presentations, too, and I am happy to elaborate more 1:1.

Reconnecting and New Connections

After 10 years away from ASUG events, I'm eager to reconnect with the friends and connections I made in the past. But equally important, I want to make new connections with enterprise architects who are tackling today's challenges‚Äîfrom clean core strategies to AI governance, from cloud migrations to business transformation.

The SAP community has always been about learning from each other, and I'm looking forward to hearing your stories, challenges, and successes.

entry.title: SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) ‚Äî –±–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω—ñ –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç—ñ
entry.content:
–ë–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω—ñ —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–∏ SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP): –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç—ñ –¥–ª—è —Ä–æ–∑—Ä–æ–±–Ω–∏–∫—ñ–≤ —Ç–∞ –±—ñ–∑–Ω–µ—Å—É

–ù–∞–≤—á–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–∏ SAP –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–∂—É—Ç—å –∑—Ä–æ–∑—É–º—ñ—Ç–∏, —è–∫ –ø–æ—î–¥–Ω—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –¥–∞–Ω—ñ, –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å–∏ —Ç–∞ —ñ–Ω–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ü—ñ—ó –Ω–∞ –æ–¥–Ω—ñ–π –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—ñ, —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∑–∞—Å—Ç–æ—Å—É–Ω–∫–∏ –±–µ–∑ –∫–æ–¥—É, –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∞–Ω–∞–ª—ñ—Ç–∏–∫—É —Ç–∞ –®–Ü —É –≤–ª–∞—Å–Ω–∏—Ö —Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è—Ö ‚Äî —É—Å–µ —Ü–µ –º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —Ä–æ–±–∏—Ç–∏ –±–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–æ —Ç–∞ —É –≤–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ–º—É —Ç–µ–º–ø—ñ.

–£ —á–∞—Å–∏, –∫–æ–ª–∏ –±—ñ–∑–Ω–µ—Å—É –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–∞ –≥–Ω—É—á–∫—ñ—Å—Ç—å, —à–≤–∏–¥–∫—ñ—Å—Ç—å —Ç–∞ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥—ñ—á–Ω–∞ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—è, –æ—Å–æ–±–ª–∏–≤–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è –º–∞—é—Ç—å –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏, —â–æ –ø–æ—î–¥–Ω—É—é—Ç—å –¥–∞–Ω—ñ, –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å–∏ —Ç–∞ –∞–Ω–∞–ª—ñ—Ç–∏–∫—É. –°–∞–º–µ —Ç–∞–∫–æ—é –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–æ—é —î SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP).

SAP BTP ‚Äî —Ü–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å–Ω–∞ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞ –¥–ª—è —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—ó, –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü—ñ—ó, —Ä–æ–∑—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—è —Ç–∞ —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—è –±—ñ–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–∑–∞—Å—Ç–æ—Å—É–Ω–∫—ñ–≤ —ñ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—ñ–≤ –Ω–∞ –±–∞–∑—ñ –®–Ü —É –≤—Å—ñ—Ö –ø—ñ–¥—Ä–æ–∑–¥—ñ–ª–∞—Ö –ø—ñ–¥–ø—Ä–∏—î–º—Å—Ç–≤–∞. –í–æ–Ω–∞ –¥–∞—î –∑–º–æ–≥—É —Ä–æ–∑—Ä–æ–±–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º, –∞–Ω–∞–ª—ñ—Ç–∏–∫–∞–º —ñ –±—ñ–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞–º —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏, —Ä–æ–∑—à–∏—Ä—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —Ç–∞ –ø—ñ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–∞—Ç–∏ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ —Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è —è–∫ –Ω–∞ –±–∞–∑—ñ SAP, —Ç–∞–∫ —ñ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ñ—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º.

–î–ª—è —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏—Ö –Ü–¢-—Ñ–∞—Ö—ñ–≤—Ü—ñ–≤ —ñ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω—ñ–π SAP –≤—ñ–¥–∫—Ä–∏–≤–∞—î –±–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–∏–π –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø –¥–æ –Ω–∞–≤—á–∞–ª—å–Ω–∏—Ö –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä—ñ–∞–ª—ñ–≤ —ñ –¥–µ–º–æ-—Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–æ–≤–∏—â, —â–æ–± –º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ –±—É–ª–æ –µ–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∑ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥—ñ—è–º–∏, —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–æ—Ç–∏–ø–∏ —Ç–∞ —Ä–æ–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –≤–ª–∞—Å–Ω—É –µ–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–∏–∑—É.

–ë–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω—ñ –æ—Å–≤—ñ—Ç–Ω—ñ —Ç–∞ –¥–æ–≤—ñ–¥–∫–æ–≤—ñ —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–∏ SAP BTP

–ù–∞–≤—á–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–∏ SAP –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–∂—É—Ç—å —Ä–æ–∑—Ä–æ–±–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º –Ω–µ –ª–∏—à–µ –æ–∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è –∑ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–æ—é —Ç–∞ —ó—ó –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏, –∞ –π –æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∏–π –¥–æ—Å–≤—ñ–¥ —É —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ñ –∑–∞—Å—Ç–æ—Å—É–Ω–∫—ñ–≤, —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç—ñ –∑ –∞–Ω–∞–ª—ñ—Ç–∏–∫–æ—é —Ç–∞ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—î—é –¥–∞–Ω–∏—Ö.

–ù–∏–∂—á–µ –Ω–∞–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–æ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ñ –±–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω—ñ —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–∏ —Ç–∞ –Ω–∞–≤—á–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä—ñ–∞–ª–∏, —è–∫—ñ –¥–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—é—Ç—å —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–º —Ñ–∞—Ö—ñ–≤—Ü—è–º –ø–æ—á–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∑ SAP BTP, —Ä–æ–∑—à–∏—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ —Å–≤–æ—ó –Ω–∞–≤–∏—á–∫–∏ —Ç–∞ –æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∞—Ç–∏ —Å–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ñ—ñ–∫–∞—Ü—ñ—é.

  • SAP BTP Trial ‚Äî —Ü–µ –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤—ñ—Å—Ç—å –æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∞—Ç–∏ 90-–¥–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–π –±–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–∏–π –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø –¥–æ –ø–æ–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä—É —Å–µ—Ä–≤—ñ—Å—ñ–≤ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏ SAP Business Technology Platform. –¢—É—Ç –º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏, —Ä–æ–∑–≥–æ—Ä—Ç–∞—Ç–∏ —Ç–∞ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –≤–ª–∞—Å–Ω—ñ —Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è, –≤–∏–∫–æ–Ω—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ –º—ñ—Å—ñ—ó —Ç–∞ –Ω–∞–≤—á–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ –∑–∞–≤–¥–∞–Ω–Ω—è, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–∂ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç—ñ —à—Ç—É—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É –∑–∞ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–≥–æ—é SAP Build Code.
  • SAP Learning Hub ‚Äì BTP Edition ‚Äî –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω-–ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞ –¥–ª—è –Ω–∞–≤—á–∞–Ω–Ω—è –∑ SAP BTP; –º—ñ—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ñ –∫—É—Ä—Å–∏, –Ω–∞–≤—á–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä—ñ–∞–ª–∏ —Ç–∞ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ñ –Ω–∞–≤—á–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ —à–ª—è—Ö–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—á–∞—Ç–∫—ñ–≤—Ü—ñ–≤ —ñ –¥–æ—Å–≤—ñ–¥—á–µ–Ω–∏—Ö –∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—á—ñ–≤.
  • SAP BTP Tutorials ‚Äî –ø–æ–∫—Ä–æ–∫–æ–≤–µ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–Ω–µ –Ω–∞–≤—á–∞–Ω–Ω—è, —è–∫–µ –¥–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—î —à–≤–∏–¥–∫–æ –æ—Å–≤–æ—ó—Ç–∏ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ñ —Å–µ—Ä–≤—ñ—Å–∏ —Ç–∞ —Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∞—Ä—ñ—ó –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏.
  • SAP BTP Webinars ‚Äî –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω-—Å–µ–º—ñ–Ω–∞—Ä–∏ –∑ –µ–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–∞–º–∏ SAP, —è–∫—ñ –æ—Ö–æ–ø–ª—é—é—Ç—å –Ω–æ–≤–∏–Ω–∫–∏ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏, –∫—Ä–∞—â—ñ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏ —Ç–∞ —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ –∫–µ–π—Å–∏ –≤–ø—Ä–æ–≤–∞–¥–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—è.
  • SAP Community ‚Äì BTP Topics ‚Äî —Å–ø—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Ç–∞ –∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—á—ñ–≤ —Ç–∞ –µ–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç—ñ–≤ SAP BTP; –º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–∏ –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è, –¥—ñ–ª–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è –¥–æ—Å–≤—ñ–¥–æ–º —Ç–∞ –∑–Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ –ø–æ—Ä–∞–¥–∏ –≤—ñ–¥ –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—ñ–æ–Ω–∞–ª—ñ–≤.
  • SAP BTP Developer‚Äôs Guide ‚Äî –¥–µ—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞ –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü—ñ—è –¥–ª—è —Ä–æ–∑—Ä–æ–±–Ω–∏–∫—ñ–≤; –ø–æ—è—Å–Ω—é—î, —è–∫ –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∑ —Å–µ—Ä–≤—ñ—Å–∞–º–∏ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏, —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —Ç–∞ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∑–∞—Å—Ç–æ—Å—É–Ω–∫–∏.
  • SAP BTP Documentation ‚Äî –æ—Ñ—ñ—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∞ –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü—ñ—è –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏; –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—î —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω—ñ—á–Ω—ñ –æ–ø–∏—Å–∏ —Å–µ—Ä–≤—ñ—Å—ñ–≤, API, —ñ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü—ñ—ó –∑ –Ω–∞–ª–∞—à—Ç—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è —Ç–∞ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è.
  • SAP BTP Blog ‚Äî –±–ª–æ–≥ –∑ –Ω–æ–≤–∏–Ω–∞–º–∏, –∞–Ω–∞–ª—ñ—Ç–∏–∫–æ—é —Ç–∞ –ø–æ—Ä–∞–¥–∞–º–∏ —â–æ–¥–æ SAP BTP; –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–∞–≥–∞—î —Å–ª—ñ–¥–∫—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∑–∞ —Ä–æ–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∫–æ–º –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏ —Ç–∞ —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–∞–º–∏ —É —Ö–º–∞—Ä–Ω–∏—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥—ñ—è—Ö.
  • SAP BTP Guidance Framework ‚Äî —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ñ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥–∞—Ü—ñ—ó —Ç–∞ —à–∞–±–ª–æ–Ω–∏ –¥–ª—è –≤–ø—Ä–æ–≤–∞–¥–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—è —Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω—å –Ω–∞ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—ñ; –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–∞–≥–∞—î —à–≤–∏–¥–∫–æ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —ñ —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞—Ç–∏ —Ç–∏–ø–æ–≤–∏—Ö –ø–æ–º–∏–ª–æ–∫.
  • SAP BTP Free Tier Model ‚Äî –æ–ø–∏—Å –±–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ä—ñ–≤–Ω—è –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø—É –¥–æ —Å–µ—Ä–≤—ñ—Å—ñ–≤ BTP; –¥–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—î —Ç–µ—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏ —Ç–∞ —ñ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏ –±–µ–∑ –∫–æ–º–µ—Ä—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏—Ö –≤–∏—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç.
  • SAP BTP and GenAI ‚Äî Strategy and Vision –ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü—ñ—è –ø—ñ–¥—Ö–æ–¥—É SAP –¥–æ –≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ –®–Ü; —Ä–æ–∑–ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–∞—î, —è–∫ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –®–Ü —É –±—ñ–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å–∏ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ SAP BTP.

–ù–∞–≤—á–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–∏

  • Discover SAP Business Technology Platform (9 –º–æ–¥—É–ª—ñ–≤, –±–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–æ) ‚Äî –ø—ñ—Å–ª—è –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è –∫—É—Ä—Å—É —Ä–æ–∑—Ä–æ–±–Ω–∏–∫–∏, –∫–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª—å—Ç–∞–Ω—Ç–∏ —Ç–∞ –∞–¥–º—ñ–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∏ –æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∞—é—Ç—å –±–∞–∑–æ–≤—ñ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–Ω—è SAP Business Technology Platform: –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç—ñ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—ó —Ç–∞ —Ä–æ–∑—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—è –¥–æ–¥–∞—Ç–∫—ñ–≤ –∑–∞ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–≥–æ—é —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–∏—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥—ñ–π, –≤–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è –∞–Ω–∞–ª—ñ—Ç–∏–∫–∏, –∞–¥–º—ñ–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—Ä—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –±–∞–∑ –¥–∞–Ω–∏—Ö —ñ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—ñ–Ω–Ω—è –¥–∞–Ω–∏–º–∏. –ê —Ç–∞–∫–æ–∂ ‚Äî —É—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è –ø—Ä–æ –∞—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–∏ –±–µ–∑–ø–µ–∫–∏ —Ç–∞ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—ñ–Ω–Ω—è —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∏–º —Ä–æ–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∫–æ–º.

entry.title: Why Devtoberfest keeps me coming back
entry.content:
Hello world, and happy Devtoberfest!

Since 2022, I‚Äôve been taking part in SAP Devtoberfest. What started out as a fun experiment has quickly turned into a tradition that I look forward to each year.

Devtoberfest is much more than collecting points or badges. It‚Äôs about learning in a playful way, exploring new aspects of the SAP ecosystem, and feeling the great energy of the SAP Community. Each task, whether challenging or simple, brings something new. Sometimes a smile, sometimes an ‚Äúaha‚Äù moment that finds its way into my daily work. The 2025 Devtoberfest is still running, and once again it has already given me many of those moments.

A personal highlight for me was being one of the winners in 2023. The prize trip took place in November 2024 and included the chance to attend ASUG TechConnect in West Palm Beach and to visit Disney World in Orlando together with the other winners and the SAP Developer Advocates. The time we spent together was inspiring and made the community spirit come alive.

None of this would be possible without the dedicated work of the SAP Developer Advocates and everyone supporting them behind the scenes. You create an event that connects developers around the world, motivates them, and makes learning fun. For that, I want to say a heartfelt thank you.

üëâWhat about you? What has been your favorite Devtoberfest moment so far?

I‚Äôd love to hear how you are experiencing this year‚Äôs journey.

Best regards,
Sebastian

entry.title: SAP Community Hobbies Series ‚Äì Colors, Creativity, and Canvases ‚Äì Sandra Sol√≠s
entry.content:
Just like smarchesini enjoys discovering and connecting with places through
running, I also love to connect with the places I visit ‚Äî but through painting. I‚Äôm
excited to continue the SAP Community Hobbies series by sharing another passion
that takes me away from the keyboard yet still connects back in surprising ways:
drawing and painting.

A Little About Me and My Hobby

Hello everyone! My name is Sandra Sol√≠s, I‚Äôm an ABAP developer from Mexico and also the creator of the YouTube channel Mundo Abaper, where I share ABAP content in Spanish. Like Sebastiano, I enjoy running, making ABAP content of course, but the hobby that truly wins my heart is drawing and painting.

Over the years, I‚Äôve explored many techniques‚Äîcolored pencils, charcoal, watercolor, acrylics, and even coffee painting. For me, every medium has its own charm and challenge.

How It All Started

My journey with art began when I was 15 years old, in secondary school, when I took an art class, and that‚Äôs when I started practicing this hobby. What started as curiosity became a lifelong practice‚Äî20 years now! Since then, my sketchbooks, canvases, and brushes have been my constant companions.

What I Love Most

When I paint, the world slows down. It‚Äôs just me and the canvas. This hobby gives me a moment of peace but also sparks unexpected creativity for my programming work. Many times, while drawing, a solution to an ABAP problem suddenly comes to my mind.

Connecting Art with SAP

At first glance, painting may seem far from the SAP world. But here‚Äôs where I find the link:

Visual thinking: Sketching helps me structure ideas, the same way I design solutions. It also helps me take notes with small drawings, which makes it easier to understand what I study and read.

  • Creative problem-solving: When I feel overwhelmed or can‚Äôt find a solution, I step away and start painting. Suddenly, while I‚Äôm painting, some answers appear, helping me get unstuck and find solutions.
  • Content creation: For my Mundo Abaper videos, I often use drawings and visual notes to explain concepts more clearly.

So while brushes and SAP might seem unrelated, creativity is the bridge between them.

Challenges Along the Way

Art is not always easy. Portraits, for example, are especially challenging‚Äîcapturing the essence of a face requires patience and practice. Learning each new technique (like watercolor vs. charcoal) also brings its own learning curve. I‚Äôve overcome these challenges through courses and, most importantly, constant practice.

Proud Moments

Some highlights of my artistic journey:

  • Portraits of the SAP Developer Advocates‚Äîpainted with coffee!

 

  • My travel journal, a tiny handmade sketchbook filled with paintings of the beautiful places I‚Äôve visited, here I show just a few ones on my sketchbook . 

    

    

  • A charcoal portrait of Madona

  • My favorite superhero in colored pencils.

  • And one special project: a handmade badge painted with acrylics that I use as a background for my videos.

I even have a iman that I use as watercolor pallet of Paint !!! perfect match between computers and painting, dont you think??

 

Myths About Painting

Many people believe painting or drawing is only for those ‚Äúborn with talent.‚Äù I strongly disagree. With a good mentor and consistent practice, anyone can improve‚Äîyes, even to the level of Van Gogh!

Tips for Beginners

  • Start with the fundamentals, no matter which painting technique you choose, they all share the same, learn lines, dots, perspective, volume, shadows, light, and composition.
  • Once you‚Äôre comfortable, choose a technique you like‚Äîwatercolor, pencils, charcoal‚Äîand deepen your skills there.

Where to Learn More

There are countless resources, both free and paid. My personal recommendation: start with YouTube tutorials to get the basics, then take structured courses to refine your technique.

As you can see, art, is more than a hobby‚Äîit‚Äôs a way to recharge, connect with us, and even find inspiration for our SAP work. I‚Äôd love to hear from you too: What hobby fuels your creativity outside of SAP?

Passing the Baton

Next, I‚Äôd like to forward to Riney Riley, who will share an exciting hobby of skydiving

entry.title: Sydney Stammtisch Recap Oct '25
entry.content:
It couldn't rain for the 3rd ##SAPStammtischSYD in a row could it?  No, it couldn't!  We actually had a pretty nice day for it and the roof at The Paragon stayed wide open

As always, it was a real joy to see brand new faces joining us.  A joy too to see some unexpected reunions happen

As you can see from the photos we trialed a new system to make it easier for newcomers to get to know everyone: Stickers and a felt pen to write your name. Judging by the blank stickers left we had about 37 or 38 attendees. I think we should make this a regular thing

Thanks so much to everyone who came along to an event this year.  We are thrilled with the great attendance but would dearly love to improve the gender balance.  Please do let us know if you have any suggestions as to how we can assist with that

See you next year!  Get in touch (or leave a comment) if you have suggestions as to where we should be meeting and even whether we should try out a different night of the week
